Live from NPR News in Washington I'm jak spear thousands of National Guard troops along with law enforcement and other rescuers are making their way into areas along the Florida Panhandle devastated by hurricane Michael NPR's Debbie leaders in Panama City and describes the scene there today
In Panama City there is just utter destruction groups have been ripped from buildings windows are blown out power poles light post twisted like they were something like a paper straw trees are snapped down everywhere every time you turn around and go down the street you can't
Because of things in the road mostly trees but also power lines pieces of billboard the front facade of a church had completely come off there is devastation on every street to just about every structure that I've seen in Panama City
NPR's Debbie Elliott Michael is now a tropical storm moving through the Carolinas on its way out to see at least half a dozen deaths are being blamed on the weather system
Senate majority leader Mitch McConnell says he is optimistic about Republicans keeping a majority in the Senate next year NPR's Kelsey Snell sat down with McConnell who's on what amounts to a victory tour are following the confirmation of Supreme Court justice Brett Kavanaugh
McConnell says the often bitter fight over Kavanaugh's nomination is giving the G ... and needed boost just weeks before the midterm election in November in an interview with NPR McConnell said Republicans are catching up to Democrats in their enthusiasm among were only three
Three weeks out the timing for a surge really couldn't have been better not to dissolve plan to understand but I mean it was a great a break for us in terms of energizing our own
People in the interview McConnell said protesters opposing half an hour like mob he added that Democrats encouraged the opposition but he's proud of Republicans are standing
Space craft bound for the international space station is safely back on the ground today after a dramatic emergency landing shortly after takeoff when the rocket malfunctioned
Rescue crews quickly located us astronaut Nick Clegg washing Cosmo Alexi of chicken and after the capsule they were in separated from the malfunctioning rocket to send it back to earth with parachutes helping to slow it down
But the second day in a row the stock market plunged bank rake dot com chief financial analyst Greg McBride says there's a simple explanation
Now that the economy's doing better interest rates are rising and uh the bond market are kind of got that memo last week and the stock market got that mental this week uh and as a result investors are predictably throwing a little bit of a temper tantrum
McBride says despite the steep losses however investors probably shouldn't panic he says that's because selling into declining market could be the worst thing an investor can do on Wall street today the Dow fell five hundred and forty five points the NASDAQ was down Ninety two points this is NPR
Scientist faces area and deliveries have increased and an alarming rate worldwide as NPR's Michaeleen Doucleff reports the rise is putting women and babies that risk
Since Nineteen Ninety the ... the Saxons around the world has more than tripled from six percent to twenty percent in several regions like parts of Latin America southeast chair in China C sections now outnumber traditional deliveries private hospitals the rates can store up to Seventy to eighty percent
Scientist riding in the Lancet journal say this right it mainly due to an increase elected C sections that are medically necessary that bring more money to hospitals
These procedures rate a woman's risk of death and life threatening complications such as bleeding and hysterectomy to start reducing the C section rate researchers they hospitals need to pay doctors just as much for traditional deliveries as they do for the Syrians ... NPR News
Testing is now determined the shock that attacked a Thirteen year old boy last month off the coast of Southern California was in fact a great white
That's according to report in the San Diego Tribune which says scientists are able to take a sample from the ... the boy was wearing when he was attacked while diving near ...
By tore through his back shoulder torso face in the ear but he's now been released from the hospital and it's expected to make a full recovery witnesses estimate the shark was around eleven feet long researchers one swimmers should be wary this time of year since drugs often travel along the Pacific coast in the fall

Live from NPR News in Washington I'm jak sphere the small Gulf Coast community of Mexico beach may have taken the hardest hit from hurricane Michael even as rescue crews continue to search for survivors and others work to restore power there NPR's Greg Allen says the damages sobering
Michael was the largest hurricane ever to hit this part of Florida the panhandle with a hundred and fifty five mile per hour winds
And you can see the evidence everywhere here uh houses that were in under construction are now just sticks many homes are missing their roofs summer missing or siding and their sides fences down most surprising things the trees trees are done everywhere crushing houses whole forest over like matchsticks
And also there on the roads making it very difficult to get in and out of Mexico beach in these other communities down here on the Florida Panhandle
Michael is now blamed for at least half a dozen deaths across Florida Georgia and North Carolina now a tropical storm Michael continues to roll across North Carolina and Virginia dumping heavy rain as it heads toward the ocean
President Trump welcome to a group of musicians to the White House today everyone from kid walk to Mike leveled the beach boys to Sam more from the group salmon Dave
Gathering came as Trump signed legislation overhauling the way music as license and songwriters are compensated Sam more said it's been a long time coming for musicians and artists
Historic moment I'm so proud when Mr Bush was in we couldn't get it done when we had Mr Obama and we couldn't get it done but we've got it done with this man [noise]
Dubbed the ... music monitor ... act the measure creates a new independent entity that will license songs to companies that play music on line nonprofit collectible in pay songwriters its name for the retirement Utah Senator who was also a musician
Tens of millions of Social Security recipients will get a boost in their benefits next year probably would stretch of low inflation the governments reported the annual cost of living adjustment or cola rise by two point eight percent in two thousand Nineteen amounts to about additional thirty nine dollars a month for the average retired worker
President Trump blamed the Federal Reserve and rising rates for this week stomach turning moves in the stock market but as NPR's Scott Horsley reports the White House insists the president is not trying to interfere with the feds independence for the second day in a row President Trump
Even though the fed has carefully telegraph it's gradual move to boost interest rates Trump claims those rates are rising faster than he and others expected
I think the fed is out of control I think what they're doing is wrong
Trump complained that said get interest rates low during much of the Obama administration during the early days the recovery he was equally critical of the Fed's easy money policies despite his concerns about interest rates Trump says he has no plans to remove fed chairman Jerome Powell Scott Horsley NPR News
Washington the dollars down five hundred and forty five points this is NPR president
Trump met in the oval office with rapper Kanye West and former football player Jim Brown today telling reporters that even though he had also had meetings with senators this was the only thing anyone seemed to care about is NPR's Tamara Keith reports this is the latest development in the mutual admiration between the rapper and the president
President Trump's media availability in the oval office with Kanye West was surreal
Is this question you're in the oval office okay how does it feel oh it is good energy in the
Meeting came about after ... performed on Saturday Night live and more a red make America great again hat stated purpose was to talk about crime in Chicago and urban empowerment But West offered thoughts on many things
Trump is on his hero's journey right now and he might not have expected to have a crazy
Like Kanye West's run up and a support but best believe we are going to make America great
Trump said it was pretty impressive adding with a laugh what do you do after that camera Keith NPR News
